sn56.24:1.2: “Mendicants, whatever perfected ones, fully awakened Buddhas truly wake up—in the past,
sn56.24:1.4: or present—all of them truly wake up to the four noble truths.
sn56.24:2.2: The noble truths of suffering, the origin of suffering, the cessation of suffering, and the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.
sn56.24:2.3: Whatever perfected ones, fully awakened Buddhas truly wake up—in the past,
sn56.24:2.5: or present—all of them truly wake up to the four noble truths.
sn56.24:3.1: That’s why you should practice meditation …”
